title: 211 (United Way)
provides: Find local shelters, food, clinics, transit help, and more. Many areas offer phone and web search.

title: findhelp (Aunt Bertha)
provides: Search local programs for food, housing, health, jobs, and more by ZIP code.

title: National Runaway Safeline (NRS)
provides: 24/7 crisis support, safety planning, and referrals for runaway and homeless youth.

title: FYSB Runaway and Homeless Youth Programs (RHY)
whoFor: Youth needing shelters, outreach, or transitional living programs
provides: Federal RHY programs including Basic Center Program (emergency shelters), Transitional Living Program, and Street Outreach.

title: Education for Homeless Children and Youth (McKinney-Vento)
provides: Information and support for education rights and school stability for students experiencing homelessness.

title: Covenant House (Find a shelter)
provides: Shelter and support services for youth. Use their shelter finder to locate help.

title: The Trevor Project (LGBTQ+ youth crisis support)
provides: 24/7 crisis support: call 1-866-488-7386, text START to 678-678, or chat online.

title: Ali Forney Center (LGBTQ+ youth housing and support)
provides: Housing and support resources for homeless LGBTQ+ youth; advocacy and guidance.

title: True Colors United (Ending LGBTQ+ youth homelessness)
whoFor: Organizations and youth advocates; resource learning
provides: Advocacy, training, and resources focused on ending LGBTQ+ youth homelessness.

title: HUD: Fair Housing Rights (report discrimination)
provides: Fair housing rights and how to report discrimination (including protections relevant to LGBTQ+ people).

title: NAFC: Find a free or low-cost clinic
provides: Locator for free or charitable clinics and pharmacies near you.

title: The Salvation Army (local help locator)
whoFor: Anyone needing clothing, hygiene support, or emergency services
provides: Find local Salvation Army programs (varies by location).

title: Goodwill Locator (donation centers, thrift, job support)
whoFor: Clothing support and job help (varies by area)
provides: Locate Goodwill stores, donation sites, and (in some areas) job/career support services.

title: National Domestic Violence Hotline (24/7)
provides: Confidential support, safety planning, and resources. If your device may be monitored, use a safer phone when possible.
